cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating NNE-NE, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday evening, then sweep across NE Florida/GA coast and race NEward into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood (Gulf side) and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast from the Big Bend, across the Florida peninsula, and Atlantic coasts of NE Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (3–5 inches expected, isolated 8 inches possible)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (only localized coastal flooding of 1–2 ft expected)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force gusts (40–50 mph) possible Monday night into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft and dangerous surf along NE Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could deliver 3–5 in (locally higher) during Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday into Tuesday across NE Florida and SE Georgia
